097
098/**
099 * Plots data that is in (theta, radius) pairs where theta equal to zero is 
100 * due north and increases clockwise.
101 */
102public class PolarPlot extends Plot implements ValueAxisPlot, Zoomable,
103        RendererChangeListener, Cloneable, Serializable {
104
105    private PolarPlotProduct2 polarPlotProduct2 = new PolarPlotProduct2();
106
107        private PolarPlotProduct polarPlotProduct = new PolarPlotProduct();
108
109        /** For serialization. */
110    private static final long serialVersionUID = 3794383185924179525L;
111
112    /** The default margin. */
113    private static final int DEFAULT_MARGIN = 20;
114
115    /** The annotation margin. */
116    private static final double ANNOTATION_MARGIN = 7.0;
117
118    /** The default angle tick unit size. */
119    public static final double DEFAULT_ANGLE_TICK_UNIT_SIZE = 45.0;
120
121    /** The default angle offset. */
122    public static final double DEFAULT_ANGLE_OFFSET = -90.0;
123
124    /** The default grid line stroke. */
125    public static final Stroke DEFAULT_GRIDLINE_STROKE = new BasicStroke(
126            0.5f, BasicStroke.CAP_BUTT, BasicStroke.JOIN_BEVEL,
127            0.0f, new float[]{2.0f, 2.0f}, 0.0f);
128
129    /** The default grid line paint. */
130    public static final Paint DEFAULT_GRIDLINE_PAINT = Color.GRAY;
131
132    /** The resourceBundle for the localization. */
133    protected static ResourceBundle localizationResources
134            = ResourceBundle.getBundle("org.jfree.chart.plot.LocalizationBundle");
135
136    /** The angles that are marked with gridlines. */
137    private List<ValueTick> angleTicks;
138
139    /** The range axis (used for the y-values). */
140    private Map<Integer, ValueAxis> axes;
141
142    /** The axis locations. */
143    private final Map<Integer, PolarAxisLocation> axisLocations;
144
145    /** Storage for the datasets. */
146    private Map<Integer, XYDataset> datasets;
147
148    /** Storage for the renderers. */
149    private Map<Integer, PolarItemRenderer> renderers;
150
151    /**
152     * The tick unit that controls the spacing between the angular grid lines.
153     */
154    private TickUnit angleTickUnit;
155
156    /**
157     * A flag that controls whether the radial minor grid-lines are visible.
158     */
159    private boolean radiusMinorGridlinesVisible;
160
161    /** The annotations for the plot. */
162    private List<String> cornerTextItems = new ArrayList<>();
163
164    /**
165     * An optional collection of legend items that can be returned by the
166     * getLegendItems() method.
167     */
168    private LegendItemCollection fixedLegendItems;
169
170    /**
171     * Storage for the mapping between datasets/renderers and range axes.  The
172     * keys in the map are Integer objects, corresponding to the dataset
173     * index.  The values in the map are List<Integer> instances (corresponding 
174     * to the axis indices).  If the map contains no
175     * entry for a dataset, it is assumed to map to the primary domain axis
176     * (index = 0).
177     */
178    private final Map<Integer, List<Integer>> datasetToAxesMap;
179
180    /**
181     * Default constructor.
182     */
183    public PolarPlot() {
184        this(null, null, null);
185    }
186
187   /**
188     * Creates a new plot.
189     *
190     * @param dataset  the dataset ({@code null} permitted).
191     * @param radiusAxis  the radius axis ({@code null} permitted).
192     * @param renderer  the renderer ({@code null} permitted).
193     */
194    public PolarPlot(XYDataset dataset, ValueAxis radiusAxis, PolarItemRenderer renderer) {
195        super();
196        this.datasets = new HashMap<>();
197        this.datasets.put(0, dataset);
198        if (dataset != null) {
199            dataset.addChangeListener(this);
200        }
201        this.angleTickUnit = new NumberTickUnit(DEFAULT_ANGLE_TICK_UNIT_SIZE);
202
203        this.axes = new HashMap<>();
204        this.datasetToAxesMap = new TreeMap<>();
205        this.axes.put(0, radiusAxis);
206        if (radiusAxis != null) {
207            radiusAxis.setPlot(this);
208            radiusAxis.addChangeListener(this);
209        }
210
211        // define the default locations for up to 8 axes...
212        this.axisLocations = new HashMap<>();
213        this.axisLocations.put(0, PolarAxisLocation.EAST_ABOVE);
214        this.axisLocations.put(1, PolarAxisLocation.NORTH_LEFT);
215        this.axisLocations.put(2, PolarAxisLocation.WEST_BELOW);
216        this.axisLocations.put(3, PolarAxisLocation.SOUTH_RIGHT);
217        this.axisLocations.put(4, PolarAxisLocation.EAST_BELOW);
218        this.axisLocations.put(5, PolarAxisLocation.NORTH_RIGHT);
219        this.axisLocations.put(6, PolarAxisLocation.WEST_ABOVE);
220        this.axisLocations.put(7, PolarAxisLocation.SOUTH_LEFT);
221
222        this.renderers = new HashMap<>();
223        this.renderers.put(0, renderer);
224        if (renderer != null) {
225            renderer.setPlot(this);
226            renderer.addChangeListener(this);
227        }
228
229        polarPlotProduct.setAngleOffset2(DEFAULT_ANGLE_OFFSET);
230        polarPlotProduct.setCounterClockwise(false);
231        polarPlotProduct2.setAngleGridlinesVisible2(true);
232        polarPlotProduct2.setAngleGridlineStroke2(DEFAULT_GRIDLINE_STROKE);
233        polarPlotProduct2.setAngleGridlinePaint2(DEFAULT_GRIDLINE_PAINT);
234
235        polarPlotProduct2.setRadiusGridlinesVisible2(true);
236        this.radiusMinorGridlinesVisible = true;
237        polarPlotProduct2.setRadiusGridlineStroke2(DEFAULT_GRIDLINE_STROKE);
238        polarPlotProduct2.setRadiusGridlinePaint2(DEFAULT_GRIDLINE_PAINT);
239        polarPlotProduct.setMargin2(DEFAULT_MARGIN);
240    }
241
242    /**
243     * Returns the plot type as a string.
244     *
245     * @return A short string describing the type of plot.
246     */
247    @Override
248    public String getPlotType() {
249       return PolarPlot.localizationResources.getString("Polar_Plot");
250    }
251
252    /**
253     * Returns the primary axis for the plot.
254     *
255     * @return The primary axis (possibly {@code null}).
256     *
257     * @see #setAxis(ValueAxis)
258     */
259    public ValueAxis getAxis() {
260        return getAxis(0);
261    }
262
263    /**
264     * Returns an axis for the plot.
265     *
266     * @param index  the axis index.
267     *
268     * @return The axis ({@code null} possible).
269     *
270     * @see #setAxis(int, ValueAxis)
271     */
272    public ValueAxis getAxis(int index) {
273        return this.axes.get(index);
274    }
275
276    /**
277     * Sets the primary axis for the plot and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent}
278     * to all registered listeners.
279     *
280     * @param axis  the new primary axis ({@code null} permitted).
281     */
282    public void setAxis(ValueAxis axis) {
283        setAxis(0, axis);
284    }
285
286    /**
287     * Sets an axis for the plot and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all
288     * registered listeners.
289     *
290     * @param index  the axis index.
291     * @param axis  the axis ({@code null} permitted).
292     *
293     * @see #getAxis(int)
294     */
295    public void setAxis(int index, ValueAxis axis) {
296        setAxis(index, axis, true);
297    }
298
299    /**
300     * Sets an axis for the plot and, if requested, sends a
301     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
302     *
303     * @param index  the axis index.
304     * @param axis  the axis ({@code null} permitted).
305     * @param notify  notify listeners?
306     *
307     * @see #getAxis(int)
308     */
309    public void setAxis(int index, ValueAxis axis, boolean notify) {
310        ValueAxis existing = getAxis(index);
311        if (existing != null) {
312            existing.removeChangeListener(this);
313        }
314        if (axis != null) {
315            axis.setPlot(this);
316        }
317        this.axes.put(index, axis);
318        if (axis != null) {
319            axis.configure();
320            axis.addChangeListener(this);
321        }
322        if (notify) {
323            fireChangeEvent();
324        }
325    }
326
327    /**
328     * Returns the location of the primary axis.
329     *
330     * @return The location (never {@code null}).
331     *
332     * @see #setAxisLocation(PolarAxisLocation)
333     */
334    public PolarAxisLocation getAxisLocation() {
335        return getAxisLocation(0);
336    }
337
338    /**
339     * Returns the location for an axis.
340     *
341     * @param index  the axis index.
342     *
343     * @return The location (possibly {@code null}).
344     *
345     * @see #setAxisLocation(int, PolarAxisLocation)
346     */
347    public PolarAxisLocation getAxisLocation(int index) {
348        return this.axisLocations.get(index);
349    }
350
351    /**
352     * Sets the location of the primary axis and sends a
353     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
354     *
355     * @param location  the location ({@code null} not permitted).
356     *
357     * @see #getAxisLocation()
358     */
359    public void setAxisLocation(PolarAxisLocation location) {
360        // delegate argument checks...
361        setAxisLocation(0, location, true);
362    }
363
364    /**
365     * Sets the location of the primary axis and, if requested, sends a
366     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
367     *
368     * @param location  the location ({@code null} not permitted).
369     * @param notify  notify listeners?
370     *
371     * @see #getAxisLocation()
372     */
373    public void setAxisLocation(PolarAxisLocation location, boolean notify) {
374        // delegate...
375        setAxisLocation(0, location, notify);
376    }
377
378    /**
379     * Sets the location for an axis and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent}
380     * to all registered listeners.
381     *
382     * @param index  the axis index.
383     * @param location  the location ({@code null} not permitted).
384     *
385     * @see #getAxisLocation(int)
386     */
387    public void setAxisLocation(int index, PolarAxisLocation location) {
388        // delegate...
389        setAxisLocation(index, location, true);
390    }
391
392    /**
393     * Sets the axis location for an axis and, if requested, sends a
394     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
395     *
396     * @param index  the axis index.
397     * @param location  the location ({@code null} not permitted).
398     * @param notify  notify listeners?
399     */
400    public void setAxisLocation(int index, PolarAxisLocation location,
401            boolean notify) {
402        Args.nullNotPermitted(location, "location");
403        this.axisLocations.put(index, location);
404        if (notify) {
405            fireChangeEvent();
406        }
407    }
408
409    /**
410     * Returns the number of domain axes.
411     *
412     * @return The axis count.
413     **/
414    public int getAxisCount() {
415        return this.axes.size();
416    }
417
418    /**
419     * Returns the primary dataset for the plot.
420     *
421     * @return The primary dataset (possibly {@code null}).
422     *
423     * @see #setDataset(XYDataset)
424     */
425    public XYDataset getDataset() {
426        return getDataset(0);
427    }
428
429    /**
430     * Returns the dataset with the specified index, if any.
431     *
432     * @param index  the dataset index.
433     *
434     * @return The dataset (possibly {@code null}).
435     *
436     * @see #setDataset(int, XYDataset)
437     */
438    public XYDataset getDataset(int index) {
439        return this.datasets.get(index);
440    }
441
442    /**
443     * Sets the primary dataset for the plot, replacing the existing dataset
444     * if there is one, and sends a {@code link PlotChangeEvent} to all
445     * registered listeners.
446     *
447     * @param dataset  the dataset ({@code null} permitted).
448     *
449     * @see #getDataset()
450     */
451    public void setDataset(XYDataset dataset) {
452        setDataset(0, dataset);
453    }
454
455    /**
456     * Sets a dataset for the plot, replacing the existing dataset at the same
457     * index if there is one, and sends a {@code link PlotChangeEvent} to all
458     * registered listeners.
459     *
460     * @param index  the dataset index.
461     * @param dataset  the dataset ({@code null} permitted).
462     *
463     * @see #getDataset(int)
464     */
465    public void setDataset(int index, XYDataset dataset) {
466        XYDataset existing = getDataset(index);
467        if (existing != null) {
468            existing.removeChangeListener(this);
469        }
470        this.datasets.put(index, dataset);
471        if (dataset != null) {
472            dataset.addChangeListener(this);
473        }
474
475        // send a dataset change event to self...
476        DatasetChangeEvent event = new DatasetChangeEvent(this, dataset);
477        datasetChanged(event);
478    }
479
480    /**
481     * Returns the number of datasets.
482     *
483     * @return The number of datasets.
484     */
485    public int getDatasetCount() {
486        return this.datasets.size();
487    }
488
489    /**
490     * Returns the index of the specified dataset, or {@code -1} if the
491     * dataset does not belong to the plot.
492     *
493     * @param dataset  the dataset ({@code null} not permitted).
494     *
495     * @return The index.
496     */
497    public int indexOf(XYDataset dataset) {
498        for (Entry<Integer, XYDataset> entry : this.datasets.entrySet()) {
499            if (entry.getValue() == dataset) {
500                return entry.getKey();
501            }
502        }
503        return -1;
504    }
505
506    /**
507     * Returns the primary renderer.
508     *
509     * @return The renderer (possibly {@code null}).
510     *
511     * @see #setRenderer(PolarItemRenderer)
512     */
513    public PolarItemRenderer getRenderer() {
514        return getRenderer(0);
515    }
516
517    /**
518     * Returns the renderer at the specified index, if there is one.
519     *
520     * @param index  the renderer index.
521     *
522     * @return The renderer (possibly {@code null}).
523     *
524     * @see #setRenderer(int, PolarItemRenderer)
525     */
526    public PolarItemRenderer getRenderer(int index) {
527        return this.renderers.get(index);
528    }
529
530    /**
531     * Sets the primary renderer, and notifies all listeners of a change to the
532     * plot.  If the renderer is set to {@code null}, no data items will
533     * be drawn for the corresponding dataset.
534     *
535     * @param renderer  the new renderer ({@code null} permitted).
536     *
537     * @see #getRenderer()
538     */
539    public void setRenderer(PolarItemRenderer renderer) {
540        setRenderer(0, renderer);
541    }
542
543    /**
544     * Sets a renderer and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all
545     * registered listeners.
546     *
547     * @param index  the index.
548     * @param renderer  the renderer.
549     *
550     * @see #getRenderer(int)
551     */
552    public void setRenderer(int index, PolarItemRenderer renderer) {
553        setRenderer(index, renderer, true);
554    }
555
556    /**
557     * Sets a renderer and, if requested, sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to
558     * all registered listeners.
559     *
560     * @param index  the index.
561     * @param renderer  the renderer.
562     * @param notify  notify listeners?
563     *
564     * @see #getRenderer(int)
565     */
566    public void setRenderer(int index, PolarItemRenderer renderer,
567                            boolean notify) {
568        PolarItemRenderer existing = getRenderer(index);
569        if (existing != null) {
570            existing.removeChangeListener(this);
571        }
572        this.renderers.put(index, renderer);
573        if (renderer != null) {
574            renderer.setPlot(this);
575            renderer.addChangeListener(this);
576        }
577        if (notify) {
578            fireChangeEvent();
579        }
580    }
581
582    /**
583     * Returns the tick unit that controls the spacing of the angular grid
584     * lines.
585     *
586     * @return The tick unit (never {@code null}).
587     */
588    public TickUnit getAngleTickUnit() {
589        return this.angleTickUnit;
590    }
591
592    /**
593     * Sets the tick unit that controls the spacing of the angular grid
594     * lines, and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
595     *
596     * @param unit  the tick unit ({@code null} not permitted).
597     */
598    public void setAngleTickUnit(TickUnit unit) {
599        Args.nullNotPermitted(unit, "unit");
600        this.angleTickUnit = unit;
601        fireChangeEvent();
602    }
603
604    /**
605     * Returns the offset that is used for all angles.
606     *
607     * @return The offset for the angles.
608     */
609    public double getAngleOffset() {
610        return this.polarPlotProduct.getAngleOffset();
611    }
612
613    /**
614     * Sets the offset that is used for all angles and sends a
615     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
616     *
617     * This is useful to let 0 degrees be at the north, east, south or west
618     * side of the chart.
619     *
620     * @param offset The offset
621     */
622    public void setAngleOffset(double offset) {
623        polarPlotProduct.setAngleOffset(offset, this);
624    }
625
626    /**
627     * Get the direction for growing angle degrees.
628     *
629     * @return {@code true} if angle increases counterclockwise,
630     *         {@code false} otherwise.
631     */
632    public boolean isCounterClockwise() {
633        return this.polarPlotProduct.getCounterClockwise();
634    }
635
636    /**
637     * Sets the flag for increasing angle degrees direction.
638     *
639     * {@code true} for counterclockwise, {@code false} for
640     * clockwise.
641     *
642     * @param counterClockwise The flag.
643     */
644    public void setCounterClockwise(boolean counterClockwise)
645    {
646        polarPlotProduct.setCounterClockwise(counterClockwise);
647    }
648
649    /**
650     * Returns a flag that controls whether or not the angle labels are visible.
651     *
652     * @return A boolean.
653     *
654     * @see #setAngleLabelsVisible(boolean)
655     */
656    public boolean isAngleLabelsVisible() {
657        return this.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleLabelsVisible();
658    }
659
660    /**
661     * Sets the flag that controls whether or not the angle labels are visible,
662     * and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
663     *
664     * @param visible  the flag.
665     *
666     * @see #isAngleLabelsVisible()
667     */
668    public void setAngleLabelsVisible(boolean visible) {
669        polarPlotProduct2.setAngleLabelsVisible(visible, this);
670    }
671
672    /**
673     * Returns the font used to display the angle labels.
674     *
675     * @return A font (never {@code null}).
676     *
677     * @see #setAngleLabelFont(Font)
678     */
679    public Font getAngleLabelFont() {
680        return this.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleLabelFont();
681    }
682
683    /**
684     * Sets the font used to display the angle labels and sends a
685     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
686     *
687     * @param font  the font ({@code null} not permitted).
688     *
689     * @see #getAngleLabelFont()
690     */
691    public void setAngleLabelFont(Font font) {
692        polarPlotProduct2.setAngleLabelFont(font, this);
693    }
694
695    /**
696     * Returns the paint used to display the angle labels.
697     *
698     * @return A paint (never {@code null}).
699     *
700     * @see #setAngleLabelPaint(Paint)
701     */
702    public Paint getAngleLabelPaint() {
703        return this.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleLabelPaint();
704    }
705
706    /**
707     * Sets the paint used to display the angle labels and sends a
708     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
709     *
710     * @param paint  the paint ({@code null} not permitted).
711     */
712    public void setAngleLabelPaint(Paint paint) {
713        polarPlotProduct2.setAngleLabelPaint(paint, this);
714    }
715
716    /**
717     * Returns {@code true} if the angular gridlines are visible, and
718     * {@code false} otherwise.
719     *
720     * @return {@code true} or {@code false}.
721     *
722     * @see #setAngleGridlinesVisible(boolean)
723     */
724    public boolean isAngleGridlinesVisible() {
725        return this.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleGridlinesVisible();
726    }
727
728    /**
729     * Sets the flag that controls whether or not the angular grid-lines are
730     * visible.
731     * <p>
732     * If the flag value is changed, a {@link PlotChangeEvent} is sent to all
733     * registered listeners.
734     *
735     * @param visible  the new value of the flag.
736     *
737     * @see #isAngleGridlinesVisible()
738     */
739    public void setAngleGridlinesVisible(boolean visible) {
740        polarPlotProduct2.setAngleGridlinesVisible(visible, this);
741    }
742
743    /**
744     * Returns the stroke for the grid-lines (if any) plotted against the
745     * angular axis.
746     *
747     * @return The stroke (possibly {@code null}).
748     *
749     * @see #setAngleGridlineStroke(Stroke)
750     */
751    public Stroke getAngleGridlineStroke() {
752        return this.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleGridlineStroke();
753    }
754
755    /**
756     * Sets the stroke for the grid lines plotted against the angular axis and
757     * sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
758     * <p>
759     * If you set this to {@code null}, no grid lines will be drawn.
760     *
761     * @param stroke  the stroke ({@code null} permitted).
762     *
763     * @see #getAngleGridlineStroke()
764     */
765    public void setAngleGridlineStroke(Stroke stroke) {
766        polarPlotProduct2.setAngleGridlineStroke(stroke, this);
767    }
768
769    /**
770     * Returns the paint for the grid lines (if any) plotted against the
771     * angular axis.
772     *
773     * @return The paint (possibly {@code null}).

776     */
777    public Paint getAngleGridlinePaint() {
778        return this.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleGridlinePaint();

921    public LegendItemCollection getFixedLegendItems() {

928     * automatically.

939    /**
940     * Add text to be displayed in the lower right hand corner and sends a
941     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
942     *
943     * @param text  the text to display ({@code null} not permitted).
944     *
945     * @see #removeCornerTextItem(String)
946     */
947    public void addCornerTextItem(String text) {
948        Args.nullNotPermitted(text, "text");
949        this.cornerTextItems.add(text);
950        fireChangeEvent();
951    }
952
953    /**
954     * Remove the given text from the list of corner text items and
955     * sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
956     *
957     * @param text  the text to remove ({@code null} ignored).
958     *
959     * @see #addCornerTextItem(String)
960     */
961    public void removeCornerTextItem(String text) {
962        boolean removed = this.cornerTextItems.remove(text);
963        if (removed) {
964            fireChangeEvent();
965        }
966    }
967
968    /**
969     * Clear the list of corner text items and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent}
970     * to all registered listeners.
971     *
972     * @see #addCornerTextItem(String)
973     * @see #removeCornerTextItem(String)
974     */
975    public void clearCornerTextItems() {
976        if (!this.cornerTextItems.isEmpty()) {
977            this.cornerTextItems.clear();
978            fireChangeEvent();
979        }
980    }
981
982    /**
983     * Generates a list of tick values for the angular tick marks.
984     *
985     * @return A list of {@link NumberTick} instances.
986     */
987    protected List<ValueTick> refreshAngleTicks() {
988        List<ValueTick> ticks = new ArrayList<>();
989        for (double currentTickVal = 0.0; currentTickVal < 360.0;
990                currentTickVal += this.angleTickUnit.getSize()) {
991            TextAnchor ta = polarPlotProduct.calculateTextAnchor(currentTickVal);
992            NumberTick tick = new NumberTick(currentTickVal,
993                this.angleTickUnit.valueToString(currentTickVal),
994                ta, TextAnchor.CENTER, 0.0);
995            ticks.add(tick);
996        }
997        return ticks;
998    }
999
1000    /**
1001     * Calculate the text position for the given degrees.
1002     *
1003     * @param angleDegrees  the angle in degrees.
1004     * 
1005     * @return The optimal text anchor.
1006     */
1007    protected TextAnchor calculateTextAnchor(double angleDegrees) {
1008        return polarPlotProduct.calculateTextAnchor(angleDegrees);
1009    }
1010
1011    /**
1012     * Maps a dataset to a particular axis.  All data will be plotted
1013     * against axis zero by default, no mapping is required for this case.
1014     *
1015     * @param index  the dataset index (zero-based).
1016     * @param axisIndex  the axis index.
1017     */
1018    public void mapDatasetToAxis(int index, int axisIndex) {
1019        List<Integer> axisIndices = new ArrayList<>(1);
1020        axisIndices.add(axisIndex);
1021        mapDatasetToAxes(index, axisIndices);
1022    }
1023
1024    /**
1025     * Maps the specified dataset to the axes in the list.  Note that the
1026     * conversion of data values into Java2D space is always performed using
1027     * the first axis in the list.
1028     *
1029     * @param index  the dataset index (zero-based).
1030     * @param axisIndices  the axis indices ({@code null} permitted).
1031     */
1032    public void mapDatasetToAxes(int index, List<Integer> axisIndices) {
1033        if (index < 0) {
1034            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Requires 'index' >= 0.");
1035        }
1036        checkAxisIndices(axisIndices);
1037        Integer key = index;
1038        this.datasetToAxesMap.put(key, new ArrayList<>(axisIndices));
1039        // fake a dataset change event to update axes...
1040        datasetChanged(new DatasetChangeEvent(this, getDataset(index)));
1041    }
1042
1043    /**
1044     * This method is used to perform argument checking on the list of
1045     * axis indices passed to mapDatasetToAxes().
1046     *
1047     * @param indices  the list of indices ({@code null} permitted).
1048     */
1049    private void checkAxisIndices(List<Integer> indices) {
1050        // axisIndices can be:
1051        // 1.  null;
1052        // 2.  non-empty, containing only Integer objects that are unique.
1053        if (indices == null) {
1054            return;  // OK
1055        }
1056        if (indices.isEmpty()) {
1057            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Empty list not permitted.");
1058        }
1059        Set<Integer> set = new HashSet<>();
1060        for (Integer i : indices) {
1061            if (set.contains(i)) {
1062                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Indices must be unique.");
1063            }
1064            set.add(i);
1065        }
1066    }
1067
1068    /**
1069     * Returns the axis for a dataset.
1070     *
1071     * @param index  the dataset index.
1072     *
1073     * @return The axis.
1074     */
1075    public ValueAxis getAxisForDataset(int index) {
1076        ValueAxis valueAxis;
1077        List<Integer> axisIndices = this.datasetToAxesMap.get(index);
1078        if (axisIndices != null) {
1079            // the first axis in the list is used for data <--> Java2D
1080            Integer axisIndex = axisIndices.get(0);
1081            valueAxis = getAxis(axisIndex);
1082        }
1083        else {
1084            valueAxis = getAxis(0);
1085        }
1086        return valueAxis;
1087    }
1088
1089    /**
1090     * Returns the index of the given axis.
1091     *
1092     * @param axis  the axis.
1093     *
1094     * @return The axis index or -1 if axis is not used in this plot.
1095     */
1096    public int getAxisIndex(ValueAxis axis) {
1097        for (Entry<Integer, ValueAxis> entry : this.axes.entrySet()) {
1098            if (axis.equals(entry.getValue())) {
1099                return entry.getKey();
1100            }
1101        }
1102        // try the parent plot
1103        Plot parent = getParent();
1104        if (parent instanceof PolarPlot) {
1105            PolarPlot p = (PolarPlot) parent;
1106            return p.getAxisIndex(axis);
1107        }
1108        return -1;
1109    }
1110
1111    /**
1112     * Returns the index of the specified renderer, or {@code -1} if the
1113     * renderer is not assigned to this plot.
1114     *
1115     * @param renderer  the renderer ({@code null} not permitted).
1116     *
1117     * @return The renderer index.
1118     */
1119    public int getIndexOf(PolarItemRenderer renderer) {
1120        Args.nullNotPermitted(renderer, "renderer");
1121        for (Entry<Integer, PolarItemRenderer> entry : this.renderers.entrySet()) {
1122            if (renderer.equals(entry.getValue())) {
1123                return entry.getKey();
1124            }
1125        }
1126        return -1;
1127    }
1128
1129    /**
1130     * Receives a chart element visitor.  Many plot subclasses will override
1131     * this method to handle their subcomponents.
1132     * 
1133     * @param visitor  the visitor ({@code null} not permitted).
1134     */
1135    @Override
1136    public void receive(ChartElementVisitor visitor) {
1137        // FIXME: handle axes and renderers
1138        visitor.visit(this);
1139    }
1140
1141    /**
1142     * Draws the plot on a Java 2D graphics device (such as the screen or a
1143     * printer).
1144     * <P>
1145     * This plot relies on a {@link PolarItemRenderer} to draw each
1146     * item in the plot.  This allows the visual representation of the data to
1147     * be changed easily.
1148     * <P>
1149     * The optional info argument collects information about the rendering of
1150     * the plot (dimensions, tooltip information etc).  Just pass in
1151     * {@code null} if you do not need this information.
1152     *
1153     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1154     * @param area  the area within which the plot (including axes and
1155     *              labels) should be drawn.
1156     * @param anchor  the anchor point ({@code null} permitted).
1157     * @param parentState  ignored.
1158     * @param info  collects chart drawing information ({@code null}
1159     *              permitted).
1160     */
1161    @Override
1162    public void draw(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area, Point2D anchor,
1163            PlotState parentState, PlotRenderingInfo info) {
1164
1165        // if the plot area is too small, just return...
1166        boolean b1 = (area.getWidth() <= MINIMUM_WIDTH_TO_DRAW);
1167        boolean b2 = (area.getHeight() <= MINIMUM_HEIGHT_TO_DRAW);
1168        if (b1 || b2) {
1169            return;
1170        }
1171
1172        // record the plot area...
1173        if (info != null) {
1174            info.setPlotArea(area);
1175        }
1176
1177        // adjust the drawing area for the plot insets (if any)...
1178        RectangleInsets insets = getInsets();
1179        insets.trim(area);
1180
1181        Rectangle2D dataArea = area;
1182        if (info != null) {
1183            info.setDataArea(dataArea);
1184        }
1185
1186        // draw the plot background and axes...
1187        drawBackground(g2, dataArea);
1188        int axisCount = this.axes.size();
1189        AxisState state = null;
1190        for (int i = 0; i < axisCount; i++) {
1191            ValueAxis axis = getAxis(i);
1192            if (axis != null) {
1193                PolarAxisLocation location = this.axisLocations.get(i);
1194                AxisState s = polarPlotProduct.drawAxis(axis, location, g2, dataArea);
1195                if (i == 0) {
1196                    state = s;
1197                }
1198            }
1199        }
1200
1201        // now for each dataset, get the renderer and the appropriate axis
1202        // and render the dataset...
1203        Shape originalClip = g2.getClip();
1204        Composite originalComposite = g2.getComposite();
1205
1206        g2.clip(dataArea);
1207        g2.setComposite(AlphaComposite.getInstance(AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER,
1208                getForegroundAlpha()));
1209        this.angleTicks = refreshAngleTicks();
1210        drawGridlines(g2, dataArea, this.angleTicks, state.getTicks());
1211        render(g2, dataArea, info);
1212        g2.setClip(originalClip);
1213        g2.setComposite(originalComposite);
1214        drawOutline(g2, dataArea);
1215        drawCornerTextItems(g2, dataArea);
1216    }
1217
1218    /**
1219     * Draws the corner text items.
1220     *
1221     * @param g2  the drawing surface.
1222     * @param area  the area.
1223     */
1224    protected void drawCornerTextItems(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area) {
1225        if (this.cornerTextItems.isEmpty()) {
1226            return;
1227        }
1228
1229        g2.setColor(Color.BLACK);
1230        double width = 0.0;
1231        double height = 0.0;
1232        for (String msg : this.cornerTextItems) {
1233            FontMetrics fm = g2.getFontMetrics();
1234            Rectangle2D bounds = TextUtils.getTextBounds(msg, g2, fm);
1235            width = Math.max(width, bounds.getWidth());
1236            height += bounds.getHeight();
1237        }
1238
1239        double xadj = ANNOTATION_MARGIN * 2.0;
1240        double yadj = ANNOTATION_MARGIN;
1241        width += xadj;
1242        height += yadj;
1243
1244        double x = area.getMaxX() - width;
1245        double y = area.getMaxY() - height;
1246        g2.drawRect((int) x, (int) y, (int) width, (int) height);
1247        x += ANNOTATION_MARGIN;
1248        for (String msg : this.cornerTextItems) {
1249            Rectangle2D bounds = TextUtils.getTextBounds(msg, g2,
1250                    g2.getFontMetrics());
1251            y += bounds.getHeight();
1252            g2.drawString(msg, (int) x, (int) y);
1253        }
1254    }
1255
1256    /**
1257     * Draws the axis with the specified index.
1258     *
1259     * @param axis  the axis.
1260     * @param location  the axis location.
1261     * @param g2  the graphics target.
1262     * @param plotArea  the plot area.
1263     *
1264     * @return The axis state.
1265     */
1266    protected AxisState drawAxis(ValueAxis axis, PolarAxisLocation location,
1267            Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D plotArea) {
1268
1269        return polarPlotProduct.drawAxis(axis, location, g2, plotArea);
1270    }
1271
1272    /**
1273     * Draws a representation of the data within the dataArea region, using the
1274     * current m_Renderer.
1275     *
1276     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1277     * @param dataArea  the region in which the data is to be drawn.
1278     * @param info  an optional object for collection dimension
1279     *              information ({@code null} permitted).
1280     */
1281    protected void render(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea,
1282            PlotRenderingInfo info) {
1283
1284        // now get the data and plot it (the visual representation will depend
1285        // on the m_Renderer that has been set)...
1286        boolean hasData = false;
1287        int datasetCount = this.datasets.size();
1288        for (int i = datasetCount - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
1289            XYDataset dataset = getDataset(i);
1290            if (dataset == null) {
1291                continue;
1292            }
1293            PolarItemRenderer renderer = getRenderer(i);
1294            if (renderer == null) {
1295                continue;
1296            }
1297            if (!DatasetUtils.isEmptyOrNull(dataset)) {
1298                hasData = true;
1299                int seriesCount = dataset.getSeriesCount();
1300                for (int series = 0; series < seriesCount; series++) {
1301                    renderer.drawSeries(g2, dataArea, info, this, dataset,
1302                            series);
1303                }
1304            }
1305        }
1306        if (!hasData) {
1307            drawNoDataMessage(g2, dataArea);
1308        }
1309    }
1310
1311    /**
1312     * Draws the gridlines for the plot, if they are visible.
1313     *
1314     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1315     * @param dataArea  the data area.
1316     * @param angularTicks  the ticks for the angular axis.
1317     * @param radialTicks  the ticks for the radial axis.
1318     */
1319    protected void drawGridlines(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea,
1320            List<ValueTick> angularTicks, List<ValueTick> radialTicks) {
1321
1322        PolarItemRenderer renderer = getRenderer();
1323        // no renderer, no gridlines...
1324        if (renderer == null) {
1325            return;
1326        }
1327
1328        // draw the domain grid lines, if any...
1329        if (isAngleGridlinesVisible()) {
1330            Stroke gridStroke = getAngleGridlineStroke();
1331            Paint gridPaint = getAngleGridlinePaint();
1332            if ((gridStroke != null) && (gridPaint != null)) {
1333                renderer.drawAngularGridLines(g2, this, angularTicks,
1334                        dataArea);
1335            }
1336        }
1337
1338        // draw the radius grid lines, if any...
1339        if (isRadiusGridlinesVisible()) {
1340            Stroke gridStroke = getRadiusGridlineStroke();
1341            Paint gridPaint = getRadiusGridlinePaint();
1342            if ((gridStroke != null) && (gridPaint != null)) {
1343                List<ValueTick> ticks = buildRadialTicks(radialTicks);
1344                renderer.drawRadialGridLines(g2, this, getAxis(), ticks, dataArea);
1345            }
1346        }
1347    }
1348
1349    /**
1350     * Create a list of ticks based on the given list and plot properties.
1351     * Only ticks of a specific type may be in the result list.
1352     *
1353     * @param allTicks A list of all available ticks for the primary axis.
1354     *        {@code null} not permitted.
1355     * @return Ticks to use for radial gridlines.
1356     */
1357    protected List<ValueTick> buildRadialTicks(List<ValueTick> allTicks) {
1358        List<ValueTick> ticks = new ArrayList<>();
1359        for (ValueTick tick : allTicks) {
1360            if (isRadiusMinorGridlinesVisible() || TickType.MAJOR.equals(tick.getTickType())) {
1361                ticks.add(tick);
1362            }
1363        }
1364        return ticks;
1365    }
1366
1367    /**
1368     * Zooms the axis ranges by the specified percentage about the anchor point.
1369     *
1370     * @param percent  the amount of the zoom.
1371     */
1372    @Override
1373    public void zoom(double percent) {
1374        for (int axisIdx = 0; axisIdx < getAxisCount(); axisIdx++) {
1375            final ValueAxis axis = getAxis(axisIdx);
1376            if (axis != null) {
1377                if (percent > 0.0) {
1378                    double radius = axis.getUpperBound();
1379                    double scaledRadius = radius * percent;
1380                    axis.setUpperBound(scaledRadius);
1381                    axis.setAutoRange(false);
1382                } else {
1383                    axis.setAutoRange(true);
1384                }
1385            }
1386        }
1387    }
1388
1389    /**
1390     * A utility method that returns a list of datasets that are mapped to a
1391     * particular axis.
1392     *
1393     * @param axisIndex  the axis index ({@code null} not permitted).
1394     *
1395     * @return A list of datasets.
1396     */
1397    private List<XYDataset> getDatasetsMappedToAxis(Integer axisIndex) { 
1398        Args.nullNotPermitted(axisIndex, "axisIndex");
1399        List<XYDataset> result = new ArrayList<>();
1400       for (Entry<Integer, XYDataset> entry : this.datasets.entrySet()) {
1401            List<Integer> mappedAxes = this.datasetToAxesMap.get(entry.getKey());
1402            if (mappedAxes == null) {
1403                if (axisIndex.equals(ZERO)) {
1404                    result.add(getDataset(entry.getKey()));
1405                }
1406            } else {
1407                if (mappedAxes.contains(axisIndex)) {
1408                    result.add(getDataset(entry.getKey()));
1409                }
1410            }
1411        }
1412        return result;
1413    }
1414
1415    /**
1416     * Returns the range for the specified axis.
1417     *
1418     * @param axis  the axis.
1419     *
1420     * @return The range.
1421     */
1422    @Override
1423    public Range getDataRange(ValueAxis axis) {
1424        Range result = null;
1425        List<XYDataset> mappedDatasets = new ArrayList<>();
1426        int axisIndex = getAxisIndex(axis);
1427        if (axisIndex >= 0) {
1428            mappedDatasets = getDatasetsMappedToAxis(axisIndex);
1429        }
1430
1431        // iterate through the datasets that map to the axis and get the union
1432        // of the ranges.
1433        for (XYDataset dataset : mappedDatasets) {
1434            if (dataset != null) {
1435                // FIXME better ask the renderer instead of DatasetUtilities
1436                result = Range.combine(result, DatasetUtils.findRangeBounds(dataset));
1437            }
1438        }
1439
1440        return result;
1441    }
1442
1443    /**
1444     * Receives notification of a change to the plot's m_Dataset.
1445     * <P>
1446     * The axis ranges are updated if necessary.
1447     *
1448     * @param event  information about the event (not used here).
1449     */
1450    @Override
1451    public void datasetChanged(DatasetChangeEvent event) {
1452        for (int i = 0; i < this.axes.size(); i++) {
1453            final ValueAxis axis = (ValueAxis) this.axes.get(i);
1454            if (axis != null) {
1455                axis.configure();
1456            }
1457        }
1458        if (getParent() != null) {
1459            getParent().datasetChanged(event);
1460        }
1461        else {
1462            super.datasetChanged(event);
1463        }
1464    }
1465
1466    /**
1467     * Notifies all registered listeners of a property change.
1468     * <P>
1469     * One source of property change events is the plot's m_Renderer.
1470     *
1471     * @param event  information about the property change.
1472     */
1473    @Override
1474    public void rendererChanged(RendererChangeEvent event) {
1475        fireChangeEvent();
1476    }
1477
1478    /**
1479     * Returns the legend items for the plot.  Each legend item is generated by
1480     * the plot's m_Renderer, since the m_Renderer is responsible for the visual
1481     * representation of the data.
1482     *
1483     * @return The legend items.
1484     */
1485    @Override
1486    public LegendItemCollection getLegendItems() {
1487        if (this.fixedLegendItems != null) {
1488            return this.fixedLegendItems;
1489        }
1490        LegendItemCollection result = new LegendItemCollection();
1491        int count = this.datasets.size();
1492        for (int datasetIndex = 0; datasetIndex < count; datasetIndex++) {
1493            XYDataset dataset = getDataset(datasetIndex);
1494            PolarItemRenderer renderer = getRenderer(datasetIndex);
1495            if (dataset != null && renderer != null) {
1496                int seriesCount = dataset.getSeriesCount();
1497                for (int i = 0; i < seriesCount; i++) {
1498                    LegendItem item = renderer.getLegendItem(i);
1499                    result.add(item);
1500                }
1501            }
1502        }
1503        return result;
1504    }
1505
1506    /**
1507     * Tests this plot for equality with another object.
1508     *
1509     * @param obj  the object ({@code null} permitted).
1510     *
1511     * @return {@code true} or {@code false}.
1512     */
1513    @Override
1514    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1515        if (obj == this) {
1516            return true;
1517        }
1518        if (!(obj instanceof PolarPlot)) {
1519            return false;
1520        }
1521        PolarPlot that = (PolarPlot) obj;
1522        if (!this.axes.equals(that.axes)) {
1523            return false;
1524        }
1525        if (!this.axisLocations.equals(that.axisLocations)) {
1526            return false;
1527        }
1528        if (!this.renderers.equals(that.renderers)) {
1529            return false;
1530        }
1531        if (!this.angleTickUnit.equals(that.angleTickUnit)) {
1532            return false;
1533        }
1534        if (this.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleGridlinesVisible() != that.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleGridlinesVisible()) {
1535            return false;
1536        }
1537        if (this.polarPlotProduct.getAngleOffset() != that.polarPlotProduct.getAngleOffset())
1538        {
1539            return false;
1540        }
1541        if (this.polarPlotProduct.getCounterClockwise() != that.polarPlotProduct.getCounterClockwise())
1542        {
1543            return false;
1544        }
1545        if (this.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleLabelsVisible() != that.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleLabelsVisible()) {
1546            return false;
1547        }
1548        if (!this.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleLabelFont().equals(that.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleLabelFont())) {
1549            return false;
1550        }
1551        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleLabelPaint(), that.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleLabelPaint())) {
1552            return false;
1553        }
1554        if (!Objects.equals(this.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleGridlineStroke(), that.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleGridlineStroke())) {
1555            return false;
1556        }
1557        if (!PaintUtils.equal(
1558            this.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleGridlinePaint(), that.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleGridlinePaint()
1559        )) {
1560            return false;
1561        }
1562        if (this.polarPlotProduct2.getRadiusGridlinesVisible() != that.polarPlotProduct2.getRadiusGridlinesVisible()) {
1563            return false;
1564        }
1565        if (!Objects.equals(this.polarPlotProduct2.getRadiusGridlineStroke(), that.polarPlotProduct2.getRadiusGridlineStroke())) {
1566            return false;
1567        }
1568        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.polarPlotProduct2.getRadiusGridlinePaint(),
1569                that.polarPlotProduct2.getRadiusGridlinePaint())) {
1570            return false;
1571        }
1572        if (this.radiusMinorGridlinesVisible !=
1573            that.radiusMinorGridlinesVisible) {
1574            return false;
1575        }
1576        if (!this.cornerTextItems.equals(that.cornerTextItems)) {
1577            return false;
1578        }
1579        if (this.polarPlotProduct.getMargin() != that.polarPlotProduct.getMargin()) {
1580            return false;
1581        }
1582        if (!Objects.equals(this.fixedLegendItems, that.fixedLegendItems)) {
1583            return false;
1584        }
1585        return super.equals(obj);
1586    }
1587
1588    /**
1589     * Returns a clone of the plot.
1590     *
1591     * @return A clone.
1592     *
1593     * @throws CloneNotSupportedException  this can occur if some component of
1594     *         the plot cannot be cloned.
1595     */
1596    @Override
1597    public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
1598        PolarPlot clone = (PolarPlot) super.clone();
1599                clone.polarPlotProduct2 = (PolarPlotProduct2) this.polarPlotProduct2.clone();
1600                clone.polarPlotProduct = (PolarPlotProduct) this.polarPlotProduct.clone();
1601        clone.axes = CloneUtils.clone(this.axes);
1602        for (int i = 0; i < this.axes.size(); i++) {
1603            ValueAxis axis = (ValueAxis) this.axes.get(i);
1604            if (axis != null) {
1605                ValueAxis clonedAxis = (ValueAxis) axis.clone();
1606                clone.axes.put(i, clonedAxis);
1607                clonedAxis.setPlot(clone);
1608                clonedAxis.addChangeListener(clone);
1609            }
1610        }
1611
1612        // the datasets are not cloned, but listeners need to be added...
1613        clone.datasets = CloneUtils.clone(this.datasets);
1614        for (int i = 0; i < clone.datasets.size(); ++i) {
1615            XYDataset d = getDataset(i);
1616            if (d != null) {
1617                d.addChangeListener(clone);
1618            }
1619        }
1620
1621        clone.renderers = CloneUtils.clone(this.renderers);
1622        for (int i = 0; i < this.renderers.size(); i++) {
1623            PolarItemRenderer renderer2 = (PolarItemRenderer) this.renderers.get(i);
1624            if (renderer2 instanceof PublicCloneable) {
1625                PublicCloneable pc = (PublicCloneable) renderer2;
1626                PolarItemRenderer rc = (PolarItemRenderer) pc.clone();
1627                clone.renderers.put(i, rc);
1628                rc.setPlot(clone);
1629                rc.addChangeListener(clone);
1630            }
1631        }
1632
1633        clone.cornerTextItems = new ArrayList<>(this.cornerTextItems);
1634
1635        return clone;
1636    }
1637
1638    /**
1639     * Provides serialization support.
1640     *
1641     * @param stream  the output stream.
1642     *
1643     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1644     */
1645    private void writeObject(ObjectOutputStream stream) throws IOException {
1646        stream.defaultWriteObject();
1647        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleGridlineStroke(), stream);
1648        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleGridlinePaint(), stream);
1649        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.polarPlotProduct2.getRadiusGridlineStroke(), stream);
1650        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.polarPlotProduct2.getRadiusGridlinePaint(), stream);
1651        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.polarPlotProduct2.getAngleLabelPaint(), stream);
1652    }
1653
1654    /**
1655     * Provides serialization support.
1656     *
1657     * @param stream  the input stream.
1658     *
1659     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1660     * @throws ClassNotFoundException  if there is a classpath problem.
1661     */
1662    private void readObject(ObjectInputStream stream)
1663        throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException {
1664
1665        stream.defaultReadObject();
1666        polarPlotProduct2.setAngleGridlineStroke2(SerialUtils.readStroke(stream));
1667        polarPlotProduct2.setAngleGridlinePaint2(SerialUtils.readPaint(stream));
1668        polarPlotProduct2.setRadiusGridlineStroke2(SerialUtils.readStroke(stream));
1669        polarPlotProduct2.setRadiusGridlinePaint2(SerialUtils.readPaint(stream));
1670        polarPlotProduct2.setAngleLabelPaint2(SerialUtils.readPaint(stream));
1671
1672        int rangeAxisCount = this.axes.size();
1673        for (int i = 0; i < rangeAxisCount; i++) {
1674            Axis axis = (Axis) this.axes.get(i);
1675            if (axis != null) {
1676                axis.setPlot(this);
1677                axis.addChangeListener(this);
1678            }
1679        }
1680        int datasetCount = this.datasets.size();
1681        for (int i = 0; i < datasetCount; i++) {
1682            Dataset dataset = (Dataset) this.datasets.get(i);
1683            if (dataset != null) {
1684                dataset.addChangeListener(this);
1685            }
1686        }
1687        int rendererCount = this.renderers.size();
1688        for (int i = 0; i < rendererCount; i++) {
1689            PolarItemRenderer renderer = (PolarItemRenderer) this.renderers.get(i);
1690            if (renderer != null) {
1691                renderer.addChangeListener(this);
1692            }
1693        }
1694    }
1695
1696    /**
1697     * This method is required by the {@link Zoomable} interface, but since
1698     * the plot does not have any domain axes, it does nothing.
1699     *
1700     * @param factor  the zoom factor.
1701     * @param state  the plot state.
1702     * @param source  the source point (in Java2D coordinates).
1703     */
1704    @Override
1705    public void zoomDomainAxes(double factor, PlotRenderingInfo state,
1706                               Point2D source) {
1707        // do nothing
1708    }
1709
1710    /**
1711     * This method is required by the {@link Zoomable} interface, but since
1712     * the plot does not have any domain axes, it does nothing.
1713     *
1714     * @param factor  the zoom factor.
1715     * @param state  the plot state.
1716     * @param source  the source point (in Java2D coordinates).
1717     * @param useAnchor  use source point as zoom anchor?
1718     */
1719    @Override
1720    public void zoomDomainAxes(double factor, PlotRenderingInfo state,
1721                               Point2D source, boolean useAnchor) {
1722        // do nothing
1723    }
1724
1725    /**
1726     * This method is required by the {@link Zoomable} interface, but since
1727     * the plot does not have any domain axes, it does nothing.
1728     *
1729     * @param lowerPercent  the new lower bound.
1730     * @param upperPercent  the new upper bound.
1731     * @param state  the plot state.
1732     * @param source  the source point (in Java2D coordinates).
1733     */
1734    @Override
1735    public void zoomDomainAxes(double lowerPercent, double upperPercent,
1736                               PlotRenderingInfo state, Point2D source) {
1737        // do nothing
1738    }
1739
1740    /**
1741     * Multiplies the range on the range axis/axes by the specified factor.
1742     *
1743     * @param factor  the zoom factor.
1744     * @param state  the plot state.
1745     * @param source  the source point (in Java2D coordinates).
1746     */
1747    @Override
1748    public void zoomRangeAxes(double factor, PlotRenderingInfo state,
1749                              Point2D source) {
1750        zoom(factor);
1751    }
1752
1753    /**
1754     * Multiplies the range on the range axis by the specified factor.
1755     *
1756     * @param factor  the zoom factor.
1757     * @param info  the plot rendering info.
1758     * @param source  the source point (in Java2D space).
1759     * @param useAnchor  use source point as zoom anchor?
1760     *
1761     * @see #zoomDomainAxes(double, PlotRenderingInfo, Point2D, boolean)
1762     */
1763    @Override
1764    public void zoomRangeAxes(double factor, PlotRenderingInfo info,
1765                              Point2D source, boolean useAnchor) {
1766        // get the source coordinate - this plot has always a VERTICAL
1767        // orientation
1768        final double sourceX = source.getX();
1769
1770        for (int axisIdx = 0; axisIdx < getAxisCount(); axisIdx++) {
1771            final ValueAxis axis = getAxis(axisIdx);
1772            if (axis != null) {
1773                if (useAnchor) {
1774                    double anchorX = axis.java2DToValue(sourceX,
1775                            info.getDataArea(), RectangleEdge.BOTTOM);
1776                    axis.resizeRange(factor, anchorX);
1777                }
1778                else {
1779                    axis.resizeRange(factor);
1780                }
1781            }
1782        }
1783    }
1784
1785    /**
1786     * Zooms in on the range axes.
1787     *
1788     * @param lowerPercent  the new lower bound.
1789     * @param upperPercent  the new upper bound.
1790     * @param state  the plot state.
1791     * @param source  the source point (in Java2D coordinates).
1792     */
1793    @Override
1794    public void zoomRangeAxes(double lowerPercent, double upperPercent,
1795                              PlotRenderingInfo state, Point2D source) {
1796        zoom((upperPercent + lowerPercent) / 2.0);
1797    }
1798
1799    /**
1800     * Returns {@code false} always.
1801     *
1802     * @return {@code false} always.
1803     */
1804    @Override
1805    public boolean isDomainZoomable() {
1806        return false;
1807    }
1808
1809    /**
1810     * Returns {@code true} to indicate that the range axis is zoomable.
1811     *
1812     * @return {@code true}.
1813     */
1814    @Override
1815    public boolean isRangeZoomable() {
1816        return true;
1817    }

1819    /**
1820     * Returns the orientation of the plot.
1821     *
1822     * @return The orientation.
1823     */
1824    @Override
1825    public PlotOrientation getOrientation() {
1826        return PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL;
1827    }
1828
1829    /**
1830     * Translates a (theta, radius) pair into Java2D coordinates.  If
1831     * {@code radius} is less than the lower bound of the axis, then
1832     * this method returns the centre point.
1833     *
1834     * @param angleDegrees  the angle in degrees.
1835     * @param radius  the radius.
1836     * @param axis  the axis.
1837     * @param dataArea  the data area.
1838     *
1839     * @return A point in Java2D space.
1840     */
1841    public Point translateToJava2D(double angleDegrees, double radius,
1842            ValueAxis axis, Rectangle2D dataArea) {
1843
1844        return polarPlotProduct.translateToJava2D(angleDegrees, radius, axis, dataArea);
1845
1846    }

1848}
